gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: AUTestingRecords2 Collection with single service URL https://test.ands.org.au/mock/get/AUTestingRecords_WMS_Response_12_v1.3.0?someparams Age of Oceanic Lithosphere

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: School of Geosciences, The University of Sydney (USYD)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This is an agegrid showing the present day age of the oceanic lithosphere around the Australian Continent . The agegrid is created using a global set of seafloor spreading isochrons, reconstructed on the basis of approximately 40,000 marine magnetic anomaly identifications and fracture zones identified from marine gravity anomalies and a global set of finite rotations.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: To study the age of the oceanic lithosphere globally.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: School of Geosciences, The University of AUTestingRecords

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Baxter Building H11, School of Geosciences

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Assoc Prof R AUTestingRecords Muzy Personal Pages

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Global Change Master Directory Earth Science Keywords v.5.3.8

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Point of truth URL of this metadata record

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: Grey areas indicate regions that are floored by continental or transitional crust or areas where the age or nature of the crust is unknown.
Magnetometer data collected from ship track data is interpolated to densely spaced grids using a computer program Intertec developed at the University of Sydney.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: AUTestingRecords2 collection with 3x service URLs (Response 1,4 & 5) Mapset: Sea Surface Temperature Quarterly Means and Variances (in the Australian Region)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Set of four maps showing mean sea surface temperature from data collected by CSIRO remote sensing division from the USA's National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) satellites. These maps have been produced by CSIRO for the National Oceans Office, as part of an ongoing commitment to natural resource planning and management through the 'National Marine Bioregionalisation' project.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: AUTestingRecords2 Collection with a bogus OGC service URL htt://bogusURL.com Surface sediment soundings from Brunskill et al 2001

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Sounding data extracted from: Continental Shelf Research 21 (2001) 157201 Geochemistry and particle size of surface sediments of Exmouth Gulf, Northwest Shelf, Australia G.J. Brunskill,*, A.R. Orpin, I. Zagorskis, K.J. Woolfe, J. Ellison DOI: 10.1016/S0278-4343(00)00076-5 Project Details: The Pilbara Marine Conservation Partnership (PMCP) was an initiative designed to enhance the net conservation benefits of the globally-significant coral reef ecosystems of the Pilbara (Western Australia) by providing an assessment of the condition and trajectory of key ecological values. These assessments were designed to inform and complement existing governance and management arrangements and the PMCP is intended to provide ongoing advice and assessment for conservation efforts in the region, providing lasting benefits. The PMCP concept is based on three core ecological components, namely: Coral Reef Health - concentrating mainly on habitat forming primary producers. Fish and Sharks - their community structure, interactions and impacts on lower trophic levels. Environmental Pressures - physical and anthropogenic factors that influence the condition of reefs and associated biota.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: Partner Institutions: CSIRO and University of Western Australia (UWA). The study is funded by the Gorgon Barrow Island Net Conservation Benefit Fund, which forms part of Western Australia's Gorgon gas project - a partnership between Chevron, ExxonMobil and Shell.

gmd:keyword.gmx:Anchor: Earth Science | Oceans | Marine Sediments | Sediment Composition

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Please contact the data custodian for detailed information.

Note: Data are available to project participants only.
Note: Data are available to project participants only.

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: Data were spatially referenced using GPS equipment, and are nominally accurate to ~10m.
Data is complete. Please refer to the published literature for more information.

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: [common] All data sets collated as part of the Pilbara Marine Conservation Partnership (PMCP) are stored within iVEC using data storage from Research Data Storage Infrastructure (RDSI). Please refer to the published literature for a detailed description of project methodology. [dataset specific] The sounding data where collected as per the reference paper. The values were extrated by Dirk Slawinski and checked against coarse GA bathymetry. Some points were found to be erroneous and the authors have been contacted with the details.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Current Meter Mooring Data overview (1983 - present)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Data collected since 1983 using moored current meters deployed at various locations around Australia and in the southern Ocean has been loaded into the the CMAR Data Warehouse. Individual metadata records contain detailed information about each experiment. Most of these data were collected by the historical CSIRO divisions of Fisheries, Oceanography, Marine Research and now Marine and Atmospheric Research.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: See detailed Current Meter (Moored) metadata records.

Moored Instrument Data: Current Meters and Tide Gauges
Mooring: ACE South Solitary Island Mooring (1983)

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Data is available under CSIRO Oceans and Atmosphere CCBY Licence

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: ATTRIBUTE STATEMENT: Field Name - (units) - Description SURVEY_NAME - name given to groupings of moored instrument deployments (eg in some cases the name of the experiment) STATION_NO - allows differentiation between the filtered data records (station 1) and where available the raw data records (station 2) START_TIME - time the meter entered the water END_TIME - time the meter exited the water NOMINAL_METER_DEPTH - (metres) - how far under water the meter was supposed to be METER_TYPE - allows differentiation between different moored instrument datasets START_LAT - (degrees) - start latitude START_LON - (degrees) - start longitude FILTER_ID - name of the filter used to produce this data from the raw format PROJECT_NAME - name assigned to project MARLIN_ID - ID of the MarLIN record which describes this dataset MODEL_NO - model number of moored instrument SERIAL_NO - equipment/instrument serial number e.g. meter number MOORING_NAME - name of grouping of moorings as used in the MarLIN record which describes the moored instrument dataset (field can be null) TIME_SECONDS - (seconds) - in seconds since 1 January on the year of start_time TIME - (DATE) - nominal time to which this record relates (UTC) TIME_QC_FLAG - quality flag associated with this item for historical records simply indicates whether data has been filtered NORTH_COMPONENT - (cm/sec) - velocity component of the current perpendicular to the equator EAST_COMPONENT - (cm/sec) - velocity component of the current parallel to the equator EAST_COMPONENT_QC_FLAG - quality flag associated with this item for historical records simply indicates whether data has been filtered SALINITY_VALUE - (practical salinity units) - derived quantity based on temperature depth and conductivity SALINITY_QC_FLAG - quality flag associated with this item for historical records simply indicates whether data has been filtered TEMPERATURE_VALUE - (Degrees C) - calibrated temperature gauge reading TEMPERATURE_QC_FLAG - quality flag associated with this item for historical records simply indicates whether data has been filtered PRESSURE - (decibars) - calibrated pressure meter reading PRESSURE_QC_FLAG - quality flag associated with this item for historical records simply indicates whether data has been filtered
